data.sentence: The word مَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.
data.sentence: The word النَّارِ comes from the root ن و ر and is associated with the meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word الْعَذَابِ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
data.sentence: The word حَقَّ comes from the root ح ق ق and is associated with the meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
The word أَفَمَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From
The word أَفَأَنْتَ comes from the root ا ن ت and is associated with the meanings: you (singular)
The word كَلِمَةُ comes from the root ك ل م and is associated with the meanings: To speak, express.
The word تُنْقِذُ comes from the root ن ق ذ and is associated with the meanings: (Nun-Qaf-Thal) to liberate, rescue, deliver.
